Running a demo to show some of python -m md_toc's capabilities...

usage: __main__.py [-h] [-c | -i] [-l] [-m TOC_MARKER] [-p] [-s SKIP_LINES]
                   [-v]
                   [FILE_NAME [FILE_NAME ...]]
                   {github,cmark,gitlab,commonmarker,redcarpet} ...

Markdown Table Of Contents: Automatically generate a compliant table
of contents for a markdown file to improve document readability.

positional arguments:
  FILE_NAME             the I/O file name

optional arguments:
  -h, --help            show this help message and exit
  -c, --no-list-coherence
                        avoids checking for TOC list coherence
  -i, --no-indentation  avoids adding indentations to the TOC
  -l, --no-links        avoids adding links to the TOC
  -m TOC_MARKER, --toc-marker TOC_MARKER
                        set the string to be used as the marker for
                        positioning the table of contents. Defaults to <!--
                        TOC-->
  -p, --in-place        overwrite the input file
  -s SKIP_LINES, --skip-lines SKIP_LINE

S
                        skip parsing of the first selected number of lines.
                        Defaults to 0, i.e. do not skip any lines
  -v, --version         show program's version number and exit

markdown parser:
  {github,cmark,gitlab,commonmarker,redcarpet}

# Hi

<!--TOC-->

hey

## How are you?           !!!

## fine, thanks

### Bye

## Bye bye

```python
# This is a code
# fence with comments that might represent ATX-style headings
# if not properly parsed
```

bye

# boo

Run with default options...
$ python -m md_toc foo.md github

Ordered list...
$ python -m md_toc foo.md gitlab -o

No links...
$ python -m md_toc -l foo.md github

- Hi
  - How are you?           !!!
  - fine, thanks
    - Bye
  - Bye bye
- boo

No links and no indentation...
$ python -m md_toc -l -i foo.md github

- Hi
- How are you?           !!!
- fine, thanks
- Bye
- Bye bye
- boo

Inspecting the non-coherent file...
$ cat foo_noncoherent.md

Trying to parse a non coherent markdown file will raise an exception...
$ python -m md_toc foo_noncoherent.md github

Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/home/vm/md-toc/md_toc/__main__.py", line 34, in main
    result = args.func(args)
  File "/home/vm/md-toc/md_toc/cli.py", line 63, in write_toc
    skip_lines=args.skip_lines)
  File "/home/vm/md-toc/md_toc/api.py", line 303, in build_multiple_tocs
    list_marker, skip_lines))
  File "/home/vm/md-toc/md_toc/api.py", line 226, in build_toc

Try to parse a non coherent markdown file without checking for coherence...
$ python -m md_toc -c foo_noncoherent.md github

Use stdin, no links and no indentation...
$ cat foo.md | python -m md_toc -l -i cmark -u '*'

* Hi
* How are you?           !!!
* fine, thanks
* Bye
* Bye bye
* boo

Inspecting a file where the first 5 lines need to be skipped...
$ cat foo_skiplines.md

# I want this line to be a comment
#### And this as well
## And this
###### ByeBye

# Hi
## How
### Are
## You
# Today ?

Using the skip lines option...
$ python -m md_toc -s 5 foo_skiplines.md github

Editing the file in-place. As you can see, code fence detection still needs to be implemented for redcarpet...
$ python -m md_toc -p foo.md redcarpet
